A **green dragon**, D, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is an adult [dragon](/wiki/Dragon "Dragon") associated with the element of [poison](/wiki/Poison "Poison"). Like all dragons, green dragons are [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong"), [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous"), [oviparous](/wiki/Oviparous "Oviparous"), [thick-skinned](/wiki/Thick-skinned "Thick-skinned"), can [see invisible](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible"), and are capable of [flight](/wiki/Flight "Flight") - they will also seek out [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold"), [gems](/wiki/Gems "Gems") and [magical items](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item") to pick up.

Green dragons have a poisonous [breath](/wiki/Breath "Breath") weapon that leaves a trail of [poison clouds](/wiki/Poison_cloud "Poison cloud"), a strong bite attack, and two claw attacks. A green dragon possesses [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance").

A green dragon [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") is poisonous to [eat](/wiki/Eat "Eat"), but eating a green dragon corpse or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") always grants poison resistance.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Green dragons and other dragons gain the additional extrinsic effects conferred by their scales.

## Generation

Randomly generated green dragons are always created hostile. A [baby green dragon](/wiki/Baby_green_dragon "Baby green dragon") can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into a green dragon.

Hostile green dragons can be generated by the [summon nasties](/wiki/Summon_nasties "Summon nasties") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell"). A [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") or monster that [polymorphs](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") while wearing [green dragon scales](/wiki/Green_dragon_scales "Green dragon scales") or [green dragon scale mail](/wiki/Green_dragon_scale_mail "Green dragon scale mail") will turn into a green dragon.

Green dragons may appear among the hostile D generated in [throne rooms](/wiki/Throne_room "Throne room") at dungeon levels 15 and below, and can also appear among the monsters randomly generated by [looting](/wiki/Looting "Looting") a [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne") while [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused") and carrying gold (provided there is no [chest](/wiki/Chest "Chest") on the level).[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Green dragons have a 1⁄3 chance of dropping a set of uncursed +0 green dragon scales upon death unless [disintegrated](/wiki/Disintegrated "Disintegrated"), and the chance is reduced to 1⁄20 if the dragon was [revived](/wiki/Revived "Revived").

## Strategy

While most heroes will have poison resistance by the time they encounter green dragons, the poison gas clouds from their breath attacks present a different problem compared to most standard sources of poison. Without poison resistance, being caught in the stream of poison can kill characters alarmingly fast even before factoring in the chance of instadeath; *with* poison resistance (and/or a source of [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") to deflect the blast), the damage and threat of death is severely lowered, but the gas clouds can still [blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind") the character, which can prove inconvenient at best in pitched combat situations.

Leaving the poison clouds and curing the blindness as soon as possible (e.g., with a [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn")) is ideal, especially for characters that lack [telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy"). Since monsters that lack poison resistance are subjected to the same effects, the clouds can also be used against other monsters, especially with a source of [conflict](/wiki/Conflict "Conflict"): poison gas can leave non-resistant monsters severely weakened from a few turns of exposure if they are not killed outright.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Green dragons gain extrinsic [sickness resistance](/wiki/Sickness_resistance "Sickness resistance") from their scales - though this is not likely to come up in practice when fighting them, this makes them possibly valuable targets for their scales if a character plans to take on the likes of [Demogorgon](/wiki/Demogorgon "Demogorgon") or else wants further insurance against [Pestilence](/wiki/Pestilence "Pestilence") on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane").

Green dragons and other large enough monsters can also inflict knockback with their melee attacks, making them exceedingly dangerous to fight near [pools](/wiki/Pool "Pool") or [lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava") and capable of forcing characters back into breath weapon range.

Wearing a [wet](/wiki/Wet "Wet") [towel](/wiki/Towel "Towel") halves damage from poison clouds.

## History

The green dragon first appears in [NetHack 2.3e](/wiki/NetHack_2.3e "NetHack 2.3e").

From [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0") to [NetHack 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.10 "NetHack 3.0.10"), including variants based on those versions, polymorphing a green dragon corpse produces regular [dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail"). [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0") introduces the current method of obtaining green dragon scale mail.

In [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0") and previous versions, including variants based on those versions, the green dragon's breath weapon is simply a ray of poison - the breath weapon's ability to create trails of poison gas is introduced in [NetHack 3.6.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.1 "NetHack 3.6.1").

## Variants

Many variants alter the green dragon and other dragons to make them more varied and/or threatening. Variants based on NetHack 3.4.3 and earlier versions may retain the green dragon's ray of poison as its breath weapon.

### SLASH'EM

- *Main article: [Dragon (SLASH'EM)](/wiki/Dragon_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Dragon (SLASH'EM)")*

As with most other dragons in SLASH'EM, the green dragon's [base level](/wiki/Monster_level "Monster level") is raised to 18, their [difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty") is raised to 25, their [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") is boosted to -4, their bite and claw attacks are stronger, and they [hit as a +3 weapon](/wiki/Hits_creatures_as_%2Bx_weapon "Hits creatures as +x weapon"). Their breath weapon fires a ray of poison as in NetHack 3.4.3.

Green dragons can appear in [dragon lairs](/wiki/Dragon_lair "Dragon lair") and [the Wyrm Caves](/wiki/The_Wyrm_Caves "The Wyrm Caves").

### NetHack brass

In [NetHack brass](/wiki/NetHack_brass "NetHack brass"), the green dragon's speed is raised to 12, and its breath weapon deals 12d12 damage.

### GruntHack

In [GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack"), the green dragon's difficulty is slightly lowered to 19, their bite and claw attacks are stronger, and they are given an additional 2d10 engulfing attack that can [digest](/wiki/Digest "Digest") targets.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") and [DynaHack](/wiki/DynaHack "DynaHack"), all dragons have their breath weapons, resistances, and names randomized each game, allowing any non-[chromatic dragon](/wiki/Chromatic_dragon_\(UnNetHack\) "Chromatic dragon (UnNetHack)") to appear as green - the default **poison dragon** is the wyvern.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), green dragons have their speed raised to 12, their difficulty is slightly raised to 21, and their effective AC is boosted to -4. The green dragon's attacks are made stronger, with an additional 4d10 tailslap attack that they will use once every global turn, and their breath attacks also ignore reflection, unless the source is from [dragon armor](/wiki/Dragon_armor_\(dNetHack\) "Dragon armor (dNetHack)") or an artifact that grants dragonbreath reflection.

Green dragons may appear among the court of a [throne room](/wiki/Throne_room#dNetHack "Throne room") ruled by an [orc of the ages of stars](/wiki/Orc_of_the_ages_of_stars "Orc of the ages of stars").

1⁄10 of the monsters randomly generated on the second Nightmare Temple level of the [Chaos Temple Quest](/wiki/Chaos_Temple_Quest "Chaos Temple Quest") will be green dragons.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), green dragons are buffed similarly to GruntHack: their attacks are made stronger as in GruntHack and reordered, including the addition of the digestion attack. Green dragons also gain [sickness resistance](/wiki/Sickness_resistance "Sickness resistance") from their scales, and both the dragons and their scales have a passive poison attack.

## Encyclopedia entry

In the West the dragon was the natural enemy of man. Although preferring to live in bleak and desolate regions, whenever it was seen among men it left in its wake a trail of destruction and disease. Yet any attempt to slay this beast was a perilous undertaking. For the dragon's assailant had to contend not only with clouds of sulphurous fumes pouring from its fire breathing nostrils, but also with the thrashings of its tail, the most deadly part of its serpent-like body.

\[ Mythical Beasts by Deirdre Headon (The Leprechaun Library) ]

  


"One whom the dragons will speak with," he said, "that is a dragonlord, or at least that is the center of the matter. It's not a trick of mastering the dragons, as most people think. Dragons have no masters. The question is always the same, with a dragon: will he talk to you or will he eat you? If you can count upon his doing the former, and not doing the latter, why then you're a dragonlord."

\[ The Tombs of Atuan, by Ursula K. Le Guin ]

Green dragons have a poisonous breath weapon that leaves a trail of poison clouds, a strong bite attack, and two claw attacks. A green dragon possesses poison resistance.

A green dragon corpse is poisonous to eat, but eating a green dragon corpse or tin always grants poison resistance.

Green dragons have a 1⁄3 chance of dropping a set of uncursed +0 green dragon scales upon death unless disintegrated, and the chance is reduced to 1⁄20 if the dragon was revived.

Without poison resistance, being caught in the stream of poison can kill characters alarmingly fast even before factoring in the chance of instadeath; with poison resistance (and/or a source of reflection to deflect the blast), the damage and threat of death is severely lowered, but the gas clouds can still blind the character, which can prove inconvenient at best in pitched combat situations.

Leaving the poison clouds and curing the blindness as soon as possible (e.g., with a [[unicorn horn]]) is ideal, especially for characters that lack [[telepathy]]. Since monsters that lack poison resistance are subjected to the same effects, the clouds can also be used against other monsters, especially with a source of [[conflict]]: poison gas can leave non-resistant monsters severely weakened from a few turns of exposure if they are not killed outright.

{{upcoming|3.7.0|Green dragons gain extrinsic [[sickness resistance]] from their scales - though this is not likely to come up in practice when fighting them, this makes them possibly valuable targets for their scales if a character plans to take on the likes of [[Demogorgon]] or else wants further insurance against [[Pestilence]] on the [[Astral Plane]].

Green dragons and other large enough monsters can also inflict knockback with their melee attacks, making them exceedingly dangerous to fight near [[pool]]s or [[lava]] and capable of forcing characters back into breath weapon range.

Wearing a [[wet]] [[towel]] halves damage from poison clouds.}}

==History==
The green dragon first appears in [[NetHack 2.3e]].

From [[NetHack 3.0.0]] to [[NetHack 3.0.10]], including variants based on those versions, polymorphing a green dragon corpse produces regular [[dragon scale mail]]. [[NetHack 3.1.0]] introduces the current method of obtaining green dragon scale mail.

In [[NetHack 3.6.0]] and previous versions, including variants based on those versions, the green dragon's breath weapon is simply a ray of poison - the breath weapon's ability to create trails of poison gas is introduced in [[NetHack 3.6.1]].

==Variants==
Many variants alter the green dragon and other dragons to make them more varied and/or threatening. Variants based on NetHack 3.4.3 and earlier versions may retain the green dragon's ray of poison as its breath weapon.

===SLASH'EM===
{{Main|Dragon (SLASH'EM)}}
As with most other dragons in SLASH'EM, the green dragon's [[Monster level|base level]] is raised to 18, their [[Monster difficulty|difficulty]] is raised to 25, their [[AC]] is boosted to -4, their bite and claw attacks are stronger, and they [[Hits creatures as +x weapon|hit as a +3 weapon]]. Their breath weapon fires a ray of poison as in NetHack 3.4.3.

Green dragons can appear in [[dragon lair]]s and [[the Wyrm Caves]].

===NetHack brass===
In [[NetHack brass]], the green dragon's speed is raised to 12, and its breath weapon deals 12d12 damage.

===GruntHack===
In [[GruntHack]], the green dragon's difficulty is slightly lowered to 19, their bite and claw attacks are stronger, and they are given an additional 2d10 engulfing attack that can [[digest]] targets.

===UnNetHack===
In [[UnNetHack]] and [[DynaHack]], all dragons have their breath weapons, resistances, and names randomized each game, allowing any non-[[Chromatic dragon (UnNetHack)|chromatic dragon]] to appear as green - the default '''poison dragon''' is the wyvern.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], [[notdNetHack]], and [[notnotdNetHack]], green dragons have their speed raised to 12, their difficulty is slightly raised to 21, and their effective AC is boosted to -4. The green dragon's attacks are made stronger, with an additional 4d10 tailslap attack that they will use once every global turn, and their breath attacks also ignore reflection, unless the source is from [[Dragon armor (dNetHack)|dragon armor]] or an artifact that grants dragonbreath reflection.

Green dragons may appear among the court of a [[Throne room#dNetHack|throne room]] ruled by an [[orc of the ages of stars]].

{{frac|10}} of the monsters randomly generated on the second Nightmare Temple level of the [[Chaos Temple Quest]] will be green dragons.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], green dragons are buffed similarly to GruntHack: their attacks are made stronger as in GruntHack and reordered, including the addition of the digestion attack. Green dragons also gain [[sickness resistance]] from their scales, and both the dragons and their scales have a passive poison attack.
